intro: Chaetolepis anisandra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while the flowers are usually purple or violet in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is popular as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of cultivation.
